title: London/Greenwich
name: The Royal Naval College
address: Old Royal Naval College, 2 Cutty Sark Gdns, SE10 9NN
hours: Painted Hall and Chapel 10:00-17:00, closed 24-26 Dec
image: https://en.wikivoyage.org/wiki/File:Old Royal Naval College, Greenwich - geograph.org.uk - 1292870.jpg
content: Built by Christopher Wren in 1694 as the Greenwich Hospital for the relief and support of seamen and their dependents and for the improvement of navigation. It became the Royal Naval College in 1869, and recently the University of Greenwich and Trinity College of Music have moved in. Best known for its Painted Hall, with elaborate ceiling and wall paintings executed by Sir James Thornhill between 1707 and 1726.
